# Relation between extreme poverty rate and capital, labor and technology contributions to the economic growth by continents

## (a) Importing data frames

```{r}
growth <- read_csv("countries_growth.csv")
poverty <- read_csv("countries_poverty.csv")

data <- growth %>% left_join(poverty)
```

## (b) Solow decomposition

```{r}
solow <- function(data, y, l, k, labsh) {
  data %>%
  mutate(
    # Logs of output, capital and labor
    y = log({{y}}),
    k = log({{k}}),
    l = log({{l}}),
    # First differences (growth rates)
    dy = ({{y}} - lag({{y}})) * 100,
    dk = ({{k}} - lag({{k}})) * 100,
    dl = ({{l}} - lag({{l}})) * 100,
    # Share of capital in the economy
    capsh = 1 - {{labsh}},
    # Contributions of factors in the output growth
    k_cont = dk * capsh,
    l_cont = dl * {{labsh}},
    tfp_cont = dy - k_cont - l_cont
  ) %>%
  na.omit()
}

data_solow <- 
  data %>%
  group_by(country) %>%
  solow(y = y,
        l = l,
        k = k,
        labsh = labsh) %>% 
  select(country:year, dy, k_cont, l_cont, tfp_cont, pov) %>% 
  ungroup()
```

## (d) Exploratory data analysis

```{r}
library(plotly)

lines <- function(data, x, y, color) {
  p <- 
    data %>%
    ggplot(aes({{x}}, {{y}}, color = {{color}})) +
    geom_line() 
  ggplotly(p)
}

data_solow %>% 
  group_by(country) %>% 
  lines(year, pov, country)
```

## (e) Panel data

```{r}
pacman::p_load(panelr, plm, broom, stargazer)
```

```{r}
# Subset
data85 <- data_solow %>% filter(year == 1985)
data19 <- data_solow %>% filter(year == 2019)
```

```{r}
library(lmtest)
library(patchwork)

# Simple regression models
m1 <- data85 %>% lm(pov ~ k_cont + l_cont + tfp_cont, data = . ) 
m1 %>% summary()

m2 <- data19 %>% lm(pov ~ k_cont + l_cont + tfp_cont, data = . )
m2 %>% summary()

# Plots
plot <- function(data, x, y) {
    data %>% 
    ggplot(aes({{x}}, {{y}})) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_smooth(method = "lm", formula = y ~ x)
}

p1 <- plot(m1, tfp_cont, pov)
p2 <- plot(m2, tfp_cont, pov)
p1 + p2
```
